sections.text: and fees; exemptions.All banking, insurance, and building and loan association corporations paying fees and making reports to the Director of Insurance or the Director of Banking and Finance and all other corporations paying an occupation tax to the state under any other statutory provisions than those of sections 21-301 to 21-330 shall be exempt from the provisions of such sections.SourceLaws 1913, c. 240, § 21, p. 752;R.S.1913, § 781;C.S.1922, § 699;C.S.1929, § 24-1721;R.S.1943, § 21-321;Laws 1969, c. 124, § 8, p. 573;Laws 1988, LB 800, § 5;Laws 2003, LB 524, § 10;Laws 2014, LB749, § 251.

21-321.Reports and fees; exemptions.

All banking, insurance, and building and loan association corporations paying fees and making reports to the Director of Insurance or the Director of Banking and Finance and all other corporations paying an occupation tax to the state under any other statutory provisions than those of sections 21-301 to 21-330 shall be exempt from the provisions of such sections.

SourceLaws 1913, c. 240, § 21, p. 752;R.S.1913, § 781;C.S.1922, § 699;C.S.1929, § 24-1721;R.S.1943, § 21-321;Laws 1969, c. 124, § 8, p. 573;Laws 1988, LB 800, § 5;Laws 2003, LB 524, § 10;Laws 2014, LB749, § 251.
